channel.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Fix how birthdays are handled
channel.description:
Right now, it's basically if someone has a friend who has an upcoming birthday, or someone (they think is) popular, they will make them a thread. This makes some people feel left out for no apparent reason, but also clutters up the general [u]DISCUSSION[/u] board.
Possible solutions: 1. Have clear boundaries about who can be made a birthday thread. Base it on post count and date last active for example, and everyone who fits the criteria gets one. 2. "Birthdays of the week" or "birthdays of the month". Consolidate the birthdays in some way. I thought the thread that we had was fine, everyone got their bit of attention in the title when it was their birthday and a bump, but apparently that's not good enough. 3. Forget the stupid birthday threads altogether and let people that actually care just PM the person. 4. Any other ideas?

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:39, topic:518911”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=637180.msg4296507#msg4296507 date=1368315547]

[quote author=Taharok link=topic=637180.msg4296473#msg4296473 date=1368307551]

TIL Regulations and rules are only for Nazi’s

Or how about idea 6:
If it such a small deal, why not just find what the popular opinion is and decide what do to based on that. Rather than just say fuck it, do whatever you want. Wouldn’t it be interesting to see if popular opinion was for more regulation, not less?

Yet, you do realize this topic only generates an opinion from an extremely small subset of the greater community, right? So it’s pretty easy for me to actually tell you we aren’t going to change this because there is no legitimate good reason to do so. If people get their feelings hurt because they don’t get a damn birthday thread then they should either post more or learn to not care about petty things like that. I’m not going to advocate the staff to do more work to prohibit people posting something as meaningless as a birthday thread for the sheer possibility somebody is going to get butthurt over it. They can get over it.
[/quote]Or you could give mods less work so they don’t have to keep locking threads when someones birthday is over

The difference between a moderator’s choice and a forced regulation is clearly missed here.
[/quote]Or you could give mods less work so they don’t have to keep locking threads when someones birthday is over

None of my ideas involve forced regulation by mods at all, just changes the way the community honors birthdays. Most communities don’t create threads for birthdays, it’s just a habit here that could easily be changed. If we change how it’s done, I see no reason as to why it would create more work for mods?

@eyeown - For #2 you would still have some sort of criteria, probably last date active

You’re under the impression that if < 0.002% of the population of this forum decide not to have birthday topics anymore, that everyone will magically understand this and stop doing it. Even if we made an announcement and changed the rules, I guarantee it wouldn’t stop anything. I would need to add a regulation to the staff and tell them they must now lock birthday topics mandatorily. Honestly, this is completely ridiculous. You are bringing up a debate about something as minimally important as a topic to celebrate the day someone was born. This has been debated since before you registered here and it hasn’t been changed since. It’s not going to change because there is no outstandingly good reason to do so.[/quote]And > 0.002% of the population of this forum bothers to make (or even reply to) birthday threads. So yes, if they agree to not have birthday topics anymore, I do think people will stop doing it. Again, new people are not used to having birthday topics on forums. Only people that have used the forums for a while would know about the tradition. It’s only active people that bother, and active people would see the change (whatever is decided), and stop doing it. Here’s a list of the users that made others birthday topics in the past year (could be missing a few if they used a strange title):

Runewings317 Classic Lin Kodiak Arham 4 Loveandpower Riipiinftw Ranger squad Kronikz_ Krackkid Soulcist Atomicint Fridder Davidi2 Flame_ thakillah jal knight Phaze One Ruby asshole_rule The Soul The Elve Age Si Force Ashley Jmood Fails Cruel Truth Whackatre drubrkletern

Nobody is saying it’s a “big deal”, but you’re also exaggerating your reasoning as to why it would be such a hugeeee inconvenience to the staff team. You can’t “guarentee” anything about veteran (for the most part) users not knowing about the change. Unless we do #3, which may be more difficult to get people to hear about, but eventually would catch on. I never knew something had to be a “big deal” to be handled… cough

No more “leaving”, “sympathy”, or “coming back” topics
